RumorFact.Text: One of the Nomai transcribed an old alien legend on a planet called Magma's Recursion
Apparently, there is an ancient signal reverberating through the area surrounding Magma's Recursion.

ExploreFact.Text: I can hear some sort of signal reverberating throughout the area that this planet resides in.
The Nomai nearly died upon entering the vicinity of Magma's Recursion, but a group of aliens came in and rescued them.
I found a transcription of an ancient alien story. According to it, the aliens were able to get an anglerfish to latch onto a giant rock while they stole its eggs.
I found a cluster of abandoned Nomai buildings.
Due to how inhospitable this planet is, the Nomai decided not to settle here, and instead only set up a couple of labs.
To help with navigation, the Nomai constructed a road that leads to both of the landmarks that they found.

The Nomai thought that the excessive heat may be due to the many recursive seeds funneling heat back towards the already burning planet. They also believed that this may be what prevented the Eye of the Universe's signal from fading away.
A Nomai named Sennetti informed a Nomai named Okalis that a gift he received from an alien was likely part of a courting ritual.

RumorFact.Text: I heard of somewhere called the Eye Signal Lab on a planet called Magma's Recursion.

ExploreFact.Text: I found a cave at the bottom of a long tunnel. My suit warns me that the gas inside is extremely flammable.

In the interest of safety, the Nomai used portable gravity crystals to navigate up to the lab. Unfortunately, many of the crystals have broken, detaching from their sockets. I don't think enough are intact to let me cross.
A Nomai named Okalis asked a Nomai named Nesia for advice regarding his romantic partnership with an alien.

Unfortunately, the signal did not tell the Nomai much more about the Eye of the Universe than what they already knew. However, they did mention that the signal may help something called the Distant Node Project bring them to the Eye.
One of the Nomai set up a recording of the tones that the Dree use to echolocate, so that he could study them while he worked on analyzing the Eye's signal.
I was able to tune my signalscope to the "Alien Echolocation" frequency.

RumorFact.Text: Supposedly, the Nomai discovered a strange, wandering rock in a cave on Magma's Recursion.

The Nomai discovered that the quantum rock in this cave can be blocked, forcing it to travel to a secret, third location. The Nomai theorized that even a small object, such as a scroll, would be enough to trigger this behavior.

ExploreFact.Text: I found a cave in the side of a hill on Magma's Recursion. The cave has a quantum rock in it.

Apparently a behavior of the rock is useful to something called the Distant Node Project. There's more details on a scroll in the cave, but a cooled lava flow is making it impossible to read fully. Despite the condition of the wall, the scroll itself appears undamaged.
I was able to ride the quantum rock to a third location.
